questions.question: Which of the following reactions will result in the formation of benzoic acid as a major product?
options: Benzene + CH3Cl, AlCl3, then KMnO4, H3O+
Nitrobenzene + Sn/HCl, then NaNO2/HCl (0-5°C), then CuCN, then H3O+

questions.question: Consider the reaction of phenol with conc. HNO3. The product formed will be:
options: A mixture of o- and p-nitrophenol

questions.question: Which reagent can be used to selectively reduce the nitro group to an amino group in the presence of a carbonyl group?
Aniline reacts with NaNO2 and HCl at 0-5°C followed by reaction with phenol in basic medium. The major product formed is:
Which of the following alkyl halides will undergo SN1 reaction most readily?
In the reaction of tert-butyl bromide with aqueous KOH, the major product formed is:
The reaction of alkyl halide with AgCN leads to the formation of:

Consider the Pinacol rearrangement of 2,3-dimethylbutane-2,3-diol in the presence of acid. The major product is:
What is the role of anhydrous AlCl3 in Friedel-Crafts reactions?
options: As a Lewis acid catalyst to generate the electrophile

questions.question: Which of the following reactions is used for the preparation of alkyl iodides from alkyl chlorides or bromides?
The reaction of an aldehyde with hydroxylamine (NH2OH) in acidic medium yields:
Which of the following statements is correct about the SN2 reaction?
options: It proceeds through a carbocation intermediate.
The rate of the reaction depends only on the concentration of the substrate.
It proceeds with inversion of configuration.
Racemic mixture is obtained if the starting material is optically active.

questions.question: Which of the following will give a secondary alcohol upon reaction with excess Grignard reagent followed by hydrolysis?
The reaction of an ester with excess LiAlH4 followed by acidification yields:
options: A carboxylic acid and an alcohol
